passage_text: 1 If you are without insurance and are in need of a physical, making an appointment with your family doctor will cost about $250. 2  Scheduling an appointment with a walk-in clinic may be cheaper, perhaps around $100. 3  However, this may not be accepted by your employer or insurance company and is usually not as extensive.

Most sports, school or camp physicals are not covered by insurance. Payment by cash or credit card is required at the time of service. We do not accept personal checks. If you want, you can also pay online with the credit card of your choice.

1 According to Walgreens.com, a camp, sports and annual school physical will cost $49, or $39 with a coupon. 2  An administrative physical at Walgreens can cost $69, while a Medicare wellness visit is $0.

1 The regular price of a physical at Walgreens can range anywhere from $35 to $69, depending on the type of physical. 2  According to Walgreens.com, a camp, sports and annual school physical will cost $49, or $39 with a coupon.

Currently, Healthcare Health Systems manages 197 clinics in 14 states. 1  The regular price of a physical at Walgreens can range anywhere from $35 to $69, depending on the type of physical. 2  According to Walgreens.com, a camp, sports and annual school physical will cost $49, or $39 with a coupon.

1 Patients covered by United One can expect a $35 copay, while those with CareFirst Blue Cross Blue Shield can expect a $25 copay. 2  For patients without health insurance, an annual physical typically costs $50-$200 or more.
We provide a variety of physicals for you and your family, including: school, camp, and sports physicals, as well as immigration examinations, health risk assessments, and DOT physicals.

1 Patients who are covered by health insurance, but are not entitled to a free visit under their plan, face a copay of $10 -$50 or more, or coinsurance of 10%-50% or more. 2  According to the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, the national average for copays is about $19.

1 Scheduling an appointment with a walk-in clinic may be cheaper, perhaps around $100. 2  However, this may not be accepted by your employer or insurance company and is usually not as extensive. 3  According to a patient on Fatwallet, his physical bills cost him more than $900 total.
